Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BTD-2 (Baboon theta-defensin-2; natural AMPs; primates, mammals, animals; 3S=S, XXC; UCBB1aB; Cys-rich; Arg-rich; BBBH2O; BBMM)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Isolated from baboon leukocytes.Activity: Diffusion assays indicates activity against E. coli ML35, S. aureus 502a, and C. albicans 16820. Active against drug resistant C. albicans clinical isolates (MIC 1.56-12.5 ug/ml) (Basso et al., 2018).MOA:  It disrupts E. coli membranes.Structure: The molecule shows concentration-dependent self aggregation into trimers in water. It adopts the typical rigid beta-hirpin structure (Conibear AC et al., 2012).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. There is alsoa crystal structure. NMR+X. Updated 11/2012; 2/2014; 5/2020; 7/2021; seq 8/2022
Literature Information.Author: Garcia AE, Osapay G, Tran PA, Yuan J, Selsted ME.2008
Literature Information.Title: Isolation, synthesis, and antimicrobial activities of naturally occurring theta-defensin isoforms from baboon leukocytes.
